definition: to hang around/to fool around/to live aimlessly
ghost/demon/terrible/damnable/clever/sly/crafty/(suffix for sb with a certain vice or addiction etc)/one of the 28 constellations
confused/dirty/to mix/muddy/variant of 渾|浑[hun2]
to mix/to mingle/muddled/to drift along/to muddle along/to pass for/to get along with sb/thoughtless/reckless

sentences.english: A doctor was having an affair with his nurse.
sentences.chinese: 有位醫生，常跟科室裏的女護士鬼混。

sentences.english: They often mucked about with some girls.
sentences.chinese: 他們常和一些姑娘們鬼混。

sentences.english: He gravitated to the Outer Rim, where he eventually began racing with outlaw swoop gangs.
sentences.chinese: 他流落到外環，開始和爲非作歹的飛車黨鬼混。
原因在於，他昨晚夢見我與他最好的朋友鬼混。

sentences.english: When homework is assigned, do not moan or complain.
sentences.chinese: 老師抱怨迪克在彈子房鬼混，不做功課。

sentences.english: I don't smoke, drink wine, and muddle along with my niggas.
sentences.chinese: 我不抽菸，不喝酒，不和兄弟們出去鬼混。

sentences.english: Long-term since carrying wife and Moll fool around on the back all the time.
sentences.chinese: 長期以來一直揹着妻子和情婦鬼混。

sentences.english: The son had an affair with a woman at the country seat fifteen miles away.
sentences.chinese: 兒子和十五里外縣城裏的一個女人鬼混。

sentences.english: I go home, and when I get there, I find my wife in bed with the gardener.
sentences.chinese: 回到家後，撞見我妻子和園丁在牀上鬼混。

sentences.english: Where have you been fooling around?
So why are you still messing with Regina, Cady?
sentences.chinese: 那你爲什麼還和莉賈娜鬼混呢凱蒂？

sentences.english: Stop larking'about and get on with your work.
sentences.chinese: 別鬼混了，去做你的工作吧。

sentences.english: She's been fooling around with a married man.
sentences.chinese: 她一直和一個有婦之夫鬼混。

sentences.english: if he’s frequently unavailable, it may be because he’s with someone else.
sentences.chinese: 如果他經常這樣，那可能在與別的女人鬼混呢。

sentences.english: He loafed about for many years.
Don't fool around with another man's wife.

definition: to make hanky-panky/to seduce women
to hang out together with (derog.)/to mix with
to spend one's time in drinking and pleasure (idiom); to indulge in sensual pleasures/life of debauchery
lit. to enjoy the beautiful spring scenery (idiom)/fig. to frequent brothels/to sow one's wild oats
to fondle the flowers and trample the grass (idiom)/to womanize/to frequent brothels/to sow one's wild oats
lit. to pick the flowers and trample the grass (idiom)/fig. to womanize/to frequent brothels/to sow one's wild oats
to make a mess/to mess with/to be wild/to sleep around/to jump into bed
to muddle along/to live aimlessly
pleasure seeking (idiom); life of dissipation
to stay out all night (idiom)
a pack of rogues (idiom); a gang of scoundrels
to mess around/to mess with something/to have an affair
to visit a prostitute
(of a woman) to take a lover
lover/mistress
lovers' rendezvous/tryst
